result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Status conference on October 2, 2017 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Michael J. McCarthy not in court. Louis John Molepske appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
8:43 a.m. DA Molepske calls the case and states the appearances.
Cases being heard are 15CM148 & 15CM149.
DA Molepske states the status of the case.
Hearing is set for a Motion to Reopen the Case and Terminate Volunteers in Probation and Sentence Defendant.
DA Molepske states defendant absconded from the Volunteers in Probation program and matter should be reopened with a Judgment of Conviction being entered and set for sentencing.

BTC:
For reasons stated on the record, State's Motion is granted.  Matter to be set for sentencing.

DA Molepske requests a Bench Warrant for the Defendant's Failure to Appear.
Court questions DA Molepske.
DA Molepske reuqests matter be set for Status Conference on an Intake date.

BTC:
Matter is set for Status Conference on October 2, 2017 at 1:30 p.m. in Branch 2.

DA Molepske requests a Bench Warrant again.

BTC:
Defendant is ordered to appear at the Status Conference on October 2, 2017.

Court questions 15CM149.
DA Molepske responds.
Court states both counts were dismissed pending the completion of the VIP Program.

BTC:
15CM149 is set for a Status Conference on October 2, 2017 at 1:30 p.m. in Branch 2.
Review hearing on September 19, 2017 at 08:15 am.
Review Hearing set for 09/08/17 at 9:30 a.m. - per post office moved, left no address
Review hearing on September 8, 2017 at 09:30 am.
& Atty Bill

Defendant Michael J. McCarthy in court with attorney Eric Sheets. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard today 15CM148 and 15CM149.

11:03 a.m.  Court calls case.
Atty Knaapen states the appearances.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
15CM148:
Count 1 - NO contest

15CM149:
Count 1 - DRI
Count 2 - DRI

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty of Count 1 on 15CM148 and on 15CM149 both counts are DRI.  Court to WITHHOLD entering Judgment of Conviction as defendant accepted into the VIP Program.

Atty Knaapen makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Sheets makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 

BY THE COURT:
15CM148:
Count 1-
Defendant accepted into the VIP Program and will be enrolled for 6 months.
Complete 20 hours of Community Service 
Participate in group or day report as deemed appropriate by the case manager.
AODA & comply with treatment recommendations.
Sign releases for treatment providers and give to the case manager.
Maintain absolute sobriety with regards to alcohol and illegal drugs.
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription.
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances.
Comply with other services as deemed appropriate by the case manager.
If defendant completes VIP Program then the case will be dismissed.

15CM149:
Count 1 - DRI
Count 2 - DRI
VIP Program Assessment and Recommendations
